page.title: 19EDUCATION IN ROWINGTON AREA
page.content: School childrens attitudes: Most of the children we interviewed seemed to enjoy school life, but like all children they critised school work, teachers and their friends. School transport: The only school oper- ating in the Rowington area was Hatton Primary School. The children travel from local villages, sometimes a 15 minute drive, the furthest coming from 6 miles away. After they leave they go to Stratford High, Henley in Arden or a private school. There is then a bus (from Hatton to Stratford) but many go in private cars. Recreation in School: The children in Hatton Primary School were aged between 4 and 11. The younger children played imaginary games, tig and climbed on the metal frames. The boys enjoyed a game of football. Girls played skipping games and catch.
